snippet: With the implicit threat of force, the Kremlin has succeeded in stifling dissent in the Crimean Peninsula, recreating the constrained conditions of Russia’s own civic sphere.
abstract: Russia moves swiftly to stifle dissent in Crimean Peninsula ahead of secession vote, using targeted intimidation and military occupation to project power to anyone who might resist; Kremlin-backed actions have, in a matter of days, succeeded in recreating the constrained conditions of Russia's own civic sphere.

byline.original: By C. J. CHIVERS and PATRICK REEVELL
byline.contributor: Andrew E. Kramer contributed reporting from Kiev, Ukraine, and Steven Lee Myers from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: With the implicit threat of force, the Kremlin has succeeded in stifling dissent in the Crimean Peninsula, recreating the constrained conditions of Russia’s own civic sphere.

headline.main: Russia Moves Swiftly to Stifle Dissent Ahead of Secession Vote
